section.section: In this subtitle, "elected member" means a voting member elected under subsection (d) or (e) of this section or a member appointed to an elected position on the Harford County Board of Education under subsection (e)(2) of this section.

"Elected member" does not include a:
County superintendent of schools serving as an ex officio member of the county board; or
Student member selected under subsection (f) of this section.
A member from a councilmanic district shall be a resident of that district.
A member from a councilmanic district who no longer resides in that district may not continue as a member of the county board.
A member of the county board shall be a registered voter of the county for at least 3 years prior to the date of the beginning of the term of office of the member.

Of the nine voting members of the county board elected or appointed under this subsection:
One member shall be elected from each of the six councilmanic districts only by the voters of that councilmanic district; and
Three members shall be appointed by the Governor.
The elected members shall be elected at a general election as required by subsection (e) of this section.
The appointed members shall be appointed, when appropriate, within 90 days of the general election.

Except for the ex officio member and the student member, a member serves for a term of 4 years beginning July 1 after the election or appointment of the member and until a successor is elected or appointed and qualifies.
Unless otherwise disqualified under this section, a member of the county board is eligible for reelection or reappointment.
A voting elected member or an appointed member may not serve for more than two consecutive terms as a voting member.
The Harford County Board of Elections may adopt regulations to implement this subsection.

The Harford County Council shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy of an elected member on the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is elected and qualifies.
The Governor shall appoint a qualified individual to fill any vacancy of an appointed member of the county board for the remainder of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
The student member of the county board shall be elected by the high school students of the county in accordance with procedures established by the Harford County public school system.

Except as otherwise provided in subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph, the student member of the county board has the same rights and privileges as a member appointed or elected under subsection (d) of this section.

Unless invited to attend by an affirmative vote of a majority of the county board, the student member may not attend an executive session of the county board addressing a matter on which a student member is prohibited from voting on under subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph.
